text: John Herman Cox (born July 15, 1955 in Chicago, Illinois) is an American accountant, businessman, broadcaster, attorney, and politician. He ran for governor of California as a Republican in the 2018 election, but lost to Gavin Newsom in the general election. He unsuccessfully ran for governor in the 2021 recall election. == Beliefs == Cox voted for Gary Johnson in the 2016 presidential election. He later said that he made a "mistake" in voting for Johnson. He was endorsed by Donald Trump in May 2018.Trump Likes Cox. In: Electoral-vote.com, 19 May 2018. Cox is pro-life, meaning that he is against abortion. He said, ”abortion is murder--plain and simple--and that should be regulated by state law.” He is against the death penalty. He supports medical cannabis. He has suggested that Marijuana users should be hospitalized instead of sent to prison. Cox is strongly against the "gas tax."
